Package de.unistuttgart.iste.rss.oo.hamstersimulator.external.model

Class Hamster

java.lang.Object
de.unistuttgart.iste.rss.oo.hamstersimulator.external.model.Hamster
Direct Known Subclasses:
LoggingHamster
public class Hamster
extends Object
Class for Hamster in the Hamster Simulator. This class allows to initialize Hamsters, command Hamsters through their territory and query their state.
Author:
Steffen Becker

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Hamster()
    Create a new Hamster object without initializing it.
    Hamster​(Territory territory, Location location, Direction direction, int newGrainCount)
    Create and initialize a new hamster object with the given parameters.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean frontIsClear()
    Checks the front of the hamster.
    Direction getDirection()
    Get the current hamster looking direction.

    Get the current hamster location.
    boolean grainAvailable()
    Checks the hamster's current tile for grain.

    Initialize a hamster object with the given parameters.

    Checks whether the hamster's mouth is empty or whether it has grains in its mouth.

    Move the hamster one step towards its looking direction.

    Read a number from the hamster simulator UI for further use.
    String readString​(String message)
    Read a string from the hamster simulator UI for further use.
    void turnLeft()
    Changes the looking direction 90 degrees to the left, e.g., when looking north the hamster will look towards west afterwards.

    Writes a new string for this hamster to the game log.

  • Constructor Details

    • Hamster

      public Hamster()
      Create a new Hamster object without initializing it.

    • Hamster

      public Hamster​(Territory territory, Location location, Direction direction, int newGrainCount)
      Create and initialize a new hamster object with the given parameters.
      Parameters:
      territory - The territory this hamster lives in.
      location - The location in the territory, where the hamster starts.
      direction - The direction in which the hamster looks initially.
      newGrainCount - The number of grain objects initially placed into the hamster's mouth.

  • Method Details

    • init

      public void init​(Territory territory, Location location, Direction direction, int newGrainCount)
      Initialize a hamster object with the given parameters. Once a hamster is initialized, the method must not be called again.
      Parameters:
      territory - The territory this hamster lives in.
      location - The location in the territory, where the hamster starts.
      direction - The direction in which the hamster looks initially.
      newGrainCount - The number of grain objects initially placed into the hamster's mouth

    • move

      public void move()
      Move the hamster one step towards its looking direction.
      Throws:
      FrontBlockedException - When the tile in front of the hamster is blocked

    • turnLeft

      public void turnLeft()
      Changes the looking direction 90 degrees to the left, e.g., when looking north the hamster will look towards west afterwards.

    • pickGrain

      public void pickGrain()
      Pick up a random grain from the tile on which the hamster is currently.
      Throws:
      NoGrainOnTileException - when no more grains are available on the hamster's tile.

    • putGrain

      public void putGrain()
      Drop a random grain object from the hamster's mouth.
      Throws:
      MouthEmptyException - when the hamster does not carry any grain.

    • readNumber

      public int readNumber​(String message)
      Read a number from the hamster simulator UI for further use.
      Parameters:
      message - The message used to prompt for the number.
      Returns:
      Number read from the user.

    • readString

      public String readString​(String message)
      Read a string from the hamster simulator UI for further use.
      Parameters:
      message - The message used to prompt for the string.
      Returns:
      String read from the user.

    • write

      public void write​(String text)
      Writes a new string for this hamster to the game log. The message will be displayed in a way that it can be associated to this hamster object.
      Parameters:
      text - The string to write to the log.

    • frontIsClear

      public boolean frontIsClear()
      Checks the front of the hamster.
      Returns:
      true if the front of the hamster is clear, i.e., the hamster could execute a move command successfully.

    • grainAvailable

      public boolean grainAvailable()
      Checks the hamster's current tile for grain.
      Returns:
      true if there are grain objects available on the hamster's current tile, i.e., a pickGrain command could execute successfully.

    • mouthEmpty

      public boolean mouthEmpty()
      Checks whether the hamster's mouth is empty or whether it has grains in its mouth.
      Returns:
      true when there are no grain objects left in the hamster's mouth, i.e., when a putGrain command can not be executed.

    • getLocation

      public Location getLocation()
      Get the current hamster location.
      Returns:
      The current hamster's location in the territory.

    • getDirection

      public Direction getDirection()
      Get the current hamster looking direction.
      Returns:
      The current hamster's looking direction.
